de.hu.gralog.structure
Interface StructureBeanFactory<GB>

Type Parameters:
GB - 
public interface StructureBeanFactory<GB>

This interface defines a Structure-Bean-Factory for GrALoG. Every GrALoG-Structure-Type that wants to define it's own Structure-Bean has to implement this Factory in order to provide this Structure-Beans via StructureTypeInfo.getStructureBeanFactory() to the Structure-Type.

Plugin-Developers

Before you implement your own StructureBeanFactory you first have to define your Structure-Bean. Like vertices and edges a Structure-Bean is basically a JavaBean which can have all or none of the following extra functionalities ( please refer to de.hu.gralog.beans for an introduction to JavaBeans ):
  • It can implement PropertyChangeListenable in order to inform the GrALoG-Structure of changes to it's properties - so that GrALoG can provide Undo-Functionality. The easiest way to do this is to extend either DefaultPropertyChangeListenableBean or DefaultPropertyAndDisplayChangeListenableBean, where the second option addionally provides functionality to force GrALoG to redraw parts of the structure - this is explained below.
  • It can implement DisplayChangeListenable in order to force GrALoG to redraw parts of or even the whole structure. This has to be used when changing the properties of the Structure-Bean affects the look of it's vertices and or edges. The easiest way to implement DisplayChangeListenable is to subclass DefaultPropertyAndDisplayChangeListenableBean, which also provides functionality to signal PropertyChangeEvent to the structure as explained above.
  • It can implement StructureBean, which allows the Structure-Bean to have access to the GrALoG-Structure that it is belongingn to and can use this to change it's behaviour ( See StructureBean for details).
So depending on your needs you can either implement one, two or all three of these features. We found that you normally need to implement all three of these features which can best be accomplished by extending DefaultPropertyAndDisplayChangeListenableBean and implementing StructureBean. Such a bean has full control over the GrALoG-Struture, it's vertices and edges and can force GrALoG at any time to update the display of this structure. You can now start to implement your bean by providing properties, an optional Customizer and / or PropertyDescriptors respectively PersistenceDelegates to your bean. This is done by using the standard mechanism for JavaBeans. If you are not familar with JavaBeans please have a look at de.hu.gralog.beans.

Author:
Sebastian
